title: Memory leak in rhinoscriptsyntax CopyObject -> DeleteObject functions
question:
Had a memry leak in a large prorgam, which made the program eather break or slow dawn alot:


The main problem was fund in the CopyObject -> DeleteObject functions:


The small test example below increased the memory uses by 474000 kb which it not freed laiter.


s = rs.AddSphere([0,0,0], 25)

for i in range(1000):
    tmp = rs.CopyObject(s)
    rs.DeleteObject(tmp)



Have tried gc.collect() to force the collecting, with no result.

code_blocks.code:
import rhinoscriptsyntax as rs

s = rs.AddSphere([0,0,0], 25)

for i in range(1000000):
    tmp = rs.CopyObject(s)
    rs.DeleteObject(tmp)
code_blocks.author: Willem

code_blocks.code:
s = rs.AddSphere([0,0,0], 25)

for i in range(1000):
    tmp = rs.CopyObject(s)
    rs.DeleteObject(tmp)
code_blocks.author: kasper_steenstrup
